name: 蔡佩芳
objective: This course introduces the theory and characteristics of network and integer programming problems. In network models, basic graph theory along with network optimization algorithms is included to have a comprehensive understanding in real-world applications. Introduction to integer programming problems includes traveling salesman problems as well as detail study of valid inequalities and branch-and-bound method, along with the concepts, techniques, mathematical analysis and justification. Emphasis is placed on the modeling and the use of commercial software.
schedule:
Week 1~3   Linear Programming Modeling
Week 4~7   Network Optimization Modeling
Week 8     Midterm Exam
Week 9~13  Integer Programming Modeling
Week 14~17 Application of Integer Programming Models
Week 18    Term Project Presentation
